entry.title: Flood Advisory issued April 14 at 3:04PM AST until April 14 at 6:00PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
entry.summary:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Cabo Rojo, Hormigueros and San German.
* WHEN...Until 600 PM AST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 304 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cabo Rojo, Lajas, San German, Hormigueros, Sabana Grande, Monte Grande, Puerto Real, Sabana Eneas, Betances, Boqueron and Pole Ojea. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cabo Rojo, PR; Hormigueros, PR; San German, PR

cap:parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST THIS EVENING

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 2:53PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
entry.summary:
At 252 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of North Vernon, or 10 miles southeast of Columbus, moving east at 75 mph.
HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Westport, Jonesville, Azalia, Letts, Millhousen, Country Squire Lakes, Elizabethtown, Butlerville, Grammer, Nebraska, North Vernon, and Columbus.
This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 53 and 60, and near mile marker 66.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bartholomew; Decatur; Jackson; Jennings

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 2:41PM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
entry.summary:
At 240 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Patriot, moving east at 55 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, nickel size hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to vegetation. Lightning can cause serious injury or death.
Locations impacted include... New Richmond, Atwood, Bradford, Grants Lick, Florence, Ryle, Northcutt, Big Bone Lick, Wheatley, New Palestine, Bracht, Gardnersville, Ricedale, Vevay, Quercus Grove, Ethridge, Woolcutt, Dry Ridge, Warsaw, and Sanders.
This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 49 and 77. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 157 and 179.
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building.
When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens.
To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Switzerland; Carroll; Gallatin; Boone; Kenton; Campbell; Owen; Grant; Pendleton; Bracken; Clermont

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 9:46AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks AK
entry.summary:
There will be periods of snow heavy at times this morning into the afternoon. Snowfall accumulations will be strictly rate driven since temperatures are above freezing. Meaning, light snow will struggle to accumulate but with any heavier rates, it will overcome the rate of melting and accumulate. This afternoon, we may see some rain mix in with the snow as temperatures slowly moderate into the mid and upper 30s.
During heavier rates of snow, it may accumulate on pavements briefly, making for difficult travel.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Chena River Valley; Tanana Flats; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Two Rivers; Fairbanks Metro Area; Nenana

entry.summary:

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 9:22AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks AK
entry.summary: A heavy band of snow has been seen moving northeast over the Nenana Hills. This area of snow will bring brief heavy snow and gusty winds, especially over the Steese, Elliott and Dalton Highways. Snowfall rates may briefly reach 1/2 to 1 inch per hour with wind gusts of 20 to 30 mph resulting in quick accumulations of an inch or 2, and visibility at 1 mile or less at times making travel difficult. The snow is expected to reach the area over the next 30 minutes to 1 hour.
entry.cap:areaDesc: White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River; Chatanika River Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 10:23AM CDT by NWS Des Moines IA
entry.summary:
WHAT...Strong winds from the northwest at 20 to around 30 mph with gusts between 35 and 45 mph, mainly dry grasses and vegetation, and low relative humidity between 30 and 40 percent will lead to elevated fire danger today.
WHERE...Much of central Iowa.
WHEN...Now until 7pm.
IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite will spread rapidly. Unsecured outdoor objects may be blown around and smaller tree branches may break.
PREPAREDNESS AND PRECAUTIONARY ACTIONS...Burning is discouraged under these conditions. Also, take care to prevent the start of accidental fires when smoking or operating vehicles around dry vegetation.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued April 14 at 5:21AM AKDT until April 17 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage AK
entry.summary:
* WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches possible. Northerly winds could gust as high as 50 to 65 mph. Visibility reduced to one-half mile of less at times.
* WHERE...Eastern Aleutians.
* WHEN...From Tuesday morning through early Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow starting Tuesday morning picks up in intensity throughout the day along with the gusty northerly winds. The worst conditions look to be between Tuesday late afternoon/early evening through early Wednesday evening before snow rates decrease. However, gusty northerly winds, snow showers, and poor visibility could linger into Thursday morning. Unalaska could see the worst conditions and most snow accumulation with this storm. Akutan will also see some snow, but warmer air looks to change precipitation over to rain/snow mix potentially Tuesday afternoon and evening. Nikolski will be cold enough for all snow but looks to be a little too far west of the best moisture axis which will be over Unalaska.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Aleutians

cap:parameter.value: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY THURSDAY MORNING

The water will approach portions of Three Rivers Lane...Altamaha River Road and Ogle Sandbar Road. At 13.0 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs in the woodlands along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the U.S. Highway 221 bridge. The water reaches the top of the public boat ramp by the bridge. Flood waters expand in low lying areas in south Montgomery County around 1.5 miles upstream from the gage. The water will begin to cover portions of Three Rivers Lane...Altamaha River Road and Ogle Sandbar Road. At 14.0 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the U.S. Highway 221 bridge. The water covers the low portion and entrance of Towns Bluff Lane by the bridge. The public boat ramp is under two feet of water. Flood waters expand further into south Montgomery County around 1.5 miles upstream from the gage. The water will be one to two feet deep over portions of Three Rivers Lane...Altamaha River Road and Ogle Sandbar Road.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 6:33PM CDT until April 14 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis TN
entry.summary:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of East Arkansas, including the following county, Poinsett.
* WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Monday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Several structures are already flooded. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 633 PM CDT, Emergency management reported flooding, especially along the Cache River and in the Pitts area. Flooding is already occurring and expected to continue. - Local rivers will continue to remain elevated through at least midweek. Continued flooding impacts are expected across a large portion of the county. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Trumann, Marked Tree, Harrisburg, Lepanto, Tyronza, Weiner, Waldenburg, Greenfield, Fisher, Whitaker, Landers, Weona, McCormick, Weona Junction, Promised Land, Old Weona, Stewart, Bay Village, Maple Grove and Wiley Crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
